metadata.synopsis: Successful theater agent Charlie Reader (Frank Sinatra) lives a playboy's life in New York City. When his childhood friend, Joe McCall (David Wayne), shows up with a desire to leave his wife, the two are awestruck by each other's lifestyle. While Charlie is busy with his newest girlfriend, marriage-obsessed actress Julie Gillis (Debbie Reynolds), Joe falls in with Sylvia (Celeste Holm), a rebuffed former flame of Charlie's, and the two friends must make different but equally important decisions.

reviews: A disappointing dated and flat romantic comedy from the 1950s.
...makes a convenient time capsule for the fifties, and at its best it's an amusing romp.
Would-be-hip look at a swinging single in NYC
